createGuild.name: Create Guild
createGuild.description: Create a new guild.  Fires a Guild Create Gateway event.
createGuild.responseNote: Returns a guild object on success.

icon.description: base64 128x128 jpeg image for the guild icon

getGuild.name: Get Guild
getGuild.responseNote: Returns the new guild object for the given id.

modifyGuild.name: Modify Guild
modifyGuild.description: Modify a guild's settings.  Fires a Guild Update Gateway event.
modifyGuild.responseNote: Returns the updated guild object on success.

icon.description: base64 128x128 jpeg image for the guild icon

owner_id.description: user id to transfer guild ownership to (must be owner)

splash.description: base64 128x128 jpeg image for the guild splash (VIP only)

deleteGuild.name: Delete Guild
deleteGuild.description: Delete a guild permanently. User must be owner.  Fires a Guild Delete Gateway event.
deleteGuild.responseNote: Returns the guild object on success.

getGuildChannels.name: Get Guild Channels
getGuildChannels.responseNote: Returns a list of guild channel objects.

createGuildChannel.name: Create Guild Channel
createGuildChannel.description: Create a new channel object for the guild. Requires the 'MANAGE_CHANNELS' permission.  Fires a Channel Create Gateway event.
createGuildChannel.responseNote: Returns the new channel object on success.

bitrate.description: the bitrate (in bits) of the voice channel (voice only)

user_limit.description: the user limit of the voice channel (voice only)

modifyGuildChannelPositions.name: Modify Guild Channel Positions
modifyGuildChannelPositions.description: Modify the positions of a set of channel objects for the guild. Requires 'MANAGE_CHANNELS' permission.  Fires multiple Channel Update Gateway events.
modifyGuildChannelPositions.responseNote: Returns a list of all of the guild's channel objects on success.

getGuildMember.name: Get Guild Member
getGuildMember.responseNote: Returns a guild member object for the specified user.

listGuildMembers.name: List Guild Members
listGuildMembers.responseNote: Returns a list of guild member objects that are members of the guild.

limit.description: max number of members to return (1-1000)

after.description: the highest user id in the previous page

addGuildMember.name: Add Guild Member
addGuildMember.description: Adds a user to the guild, provided you have a valid oauth2 access token for the user with the guilds.join scope.  Fires a Guild Member Add Gateway event. Requires the bot to have the CREATE_INSTANT_INVITE permission.
addGuildMember.responseNote: Returns a 201 Created with the guild member as the body.

access_token.description: an oauth2 access token granted with the guilds.join to the bot's application for the user you want to add to the guild

nick.description: value to set users nickname to

roles.description: array of roles the member is assigned

modifyGuildMember.name: Modify Guild Member
modifyGuildMember.description: Modify attributes of a guild member.  Fires a Guild Member Update Gateway event.
modifyGuildMember.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

nick.description: value to set users nickname to

roles.description: array of roles the member is assigned

channel_id.description: id of channel to move user to (if they are connected to voice)

modifyCurrentUsersNick.name: Modify Current User's Nick
modifyCurrentUsersNick.description: Modifies the nickname of the current user in a guild.  Fires a Guild Member Update Gateway event.
modifyCurrentUsersNick.responseNote: Returns a 200 with the nickname on success.

nick.description: value to set users nickname to

addGuildMemberRole.name: Add Guild Member Role
addGuildMemberRole.description: Adds a role to a guild member. Requires the 'MANAGE_ROLES' permission.  Fires a Guild Member Update Gateway event.
addGuildMemberRole.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

removeGuildMemberRole.name: Remove Guild Member Role
removeGuildMemberRole.description: Removes a role from a guild member. Requires the 'MANAGE_ROLES' permission.  Fires a Guild Member Update Gateway event.
removeGuildMemberRole.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

removeGuildMember.name: Remove Guild Member
removeGuildMember.description: Remove a member from a guild. Requires 'KICK_MEMBERS' permission.  Fires a Guild Member Remove Gateway event.
removeGuildMember.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

getGuildBans.name: Get Guild Bans
getGuildBans.responseNote: Returns a list of user objects that are banned from this guild.

createGuildBan.name: Create Guild Ban
createGuildBan.description: Create a guild ban, and optionally delete previous messages sent by the banned user. Requires the 'BAN_MEMBERS' permission.  Fires a Guild Ban Add Gateway event.
createGuildBan.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

delete-message-days.description: number of days to delete messages for (0-7)

removeGuildBan.name: Remove Guild Ban
removeGuildBan.description: Remove the ban for a user. Requires the 'BAN_MEMBERS' permissions.  Fires a Guild Ban Remove Gateway event.
removeGuildBan.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

getGuildRoles.name: Get Guild Roles
getGuildRoles.responseNote: Returns a list of role objects for the guild.

createGuildRole.name: Create Guild Role
createGuildRole.description: Create a new role for the guild. Requires the 'MANAGE_ROLES' permission.  Fires a Guild Role Create Gateway event. All JSON params are optional.
createGuildRole.responseNote: Returns the new role object on success.

hoist.description: whether the role should be displayed separately in the sidebar

mentionable.description: whether the role should be mentionable

modifyGuildRolePositions.name: Modify Guild Role Positions
modifyGuildRolePositions.description: Modify the positions of a set of role objects for the guild. Requires the 'MANAGE_ROLES' permission.  Fires multiple Guild Role Update Gateway events.
modifyGuildRolePositions.responseNote: Returns a list of all of the guild's role objects on success.

modifyGuildRole.name: Modify Guild Role
modifyGuildRole.description: Modify a guild role. Requires the 'MANAGE_ROLES' permission.  Fires a Guild Role Update Gateway event.
modifyGuildRole.responseNote: Returns the updated role on success.

hoist.description: whether the role should be displayed separately in the sidebar

mentionable.description: whether the role should be mentionable

deleteGuildRole.name: Delete Guild Role
deleteGuildRole.description: Delete a guild role. Requires the 'MANAGE_ROLES' permission.  Fires a Guild Role Delete Gateway event.
deleteGuildRole.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

getGuildPruneCount.name: Get Guild Prune Count
getGuildPruneCount.responseNote: Returns an object with one 'pruned' key indicating the number of members that would be removed in a prune operation.

days.description: number of days to count prune for (1 or more)

beginGuildPrune.name: Begin Guild Prune
beginGuildPrune.description: Begin a prune operation. Requires the 'KICK_MEMBERS' permission.  Fires multiple Guild Member Remove Gateway events.
beginGuildPrune.responseNote: Returns an object with one 'pruned' key indicating the number of members that were removed in the prune operation.

days.description: number of days to prune (1 or more)

getGuildVoiceRegions.name: Get Guild Voice Regions
getGuildVoiceRegions.description: Unlike the similar /voice route, this returns VIP servers when the guild is VIP-enabled.
getGuildVoiceRegions.responseNote: Returns a list of voice region objects for the guild.

getGuildInvites.name: Get Guild Invites
getGuildInvites.responseNote: Returns a list of invite objects (with invite metadata) for the guild.

getGuildIntegrations.name: Get Guild Integrations
getGuildIntegrations.responseNote: Returns a list of integration objects for the guild.

createGuildIntegration.name: Create Guild Integration
createGuildIntegration.description: Attach an integration object from the current user to the guild. Requires the 'MANAGE_GUILD' permission.  Fires a Guild Integrations Update Gateway event.
createGuildIntegration.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

modifyGuildIntegration.name: Modify Guild Integration
modifyGuildIntegration.description: Modify the behavior and settings of a integration object for the guild. Requires the 'MANAGE_GUILD' permission.  Fires a Guild Integrations Update Gateway event.
modifyGuildIntegration.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

expire_behavior.description: the behavior when an integration subscription lapses (see the integration object documentation)

expire_grace_period.description: period (in seconds) where the integration will ignore lapsed subscriptions

enable_emoticons.description: whether emoticons should be synced for this integration (twitch only currently)

deleteGuildIntegration.name: Delete Guild Integration
deleteGuildIntegration.description: Delete the attached integration object for the guild. Requires the 'MANAGE_GUILD' permission.  Fires a Guild Integrations Update Gateway event.
deleteGuildIntegration.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

syncGuildIntegration.name: Sync Guild Integration
syncGuildIntegration.description: Sync an integration. Requires the 'MANAGE_GUILD' permission.
syncGuildIntegration.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

modifyGuildEmbed.name: Modify Guild Embed
modifyGuildEmbed.description: Modify a guild embed object for the guild. All attributes may be passed in with JSON and modified. Requires the 'MANAGE_GUILD' permission.
modifyGuildEmbed.responseNote: Returns the updated guild embed object.

updateNick.name: Update Current Users' Nickname
updateNick.description: Updates the bots nickname in a server

getChannel.name: Get Channel
getChannel.responseNote: Returns a guild channel or dm channel object.

modifyChannel.name: Modify Channel
modifyChannel.description: Update a channels settings. Requires the 'MANAGE_GUILD' permission for the guild.  Fires a Channel Update Gateway event. For the PATCH method, all the JSON Params are optional.
modifyChannel.responseNote: Returns a guild channel on success, and a 400 BAD REQUEST on invalid parameters.

position.description: the position of the channel in the left-hand listing

bitrate.description: the bitrate (in bits) of the voice channel; 8000 to 96000 (128000 for VIP servers)

user_limit.description: the user limit of the voice channel; 0 refers to no limit, 1 to 99 refers to a user limit

deletecloseChannel.name: Delete/Close Channel
deletecloseChannel.description: Delete a guild channel, or close a private message. Requires the 'MANAGE_CHANNELS' permission for the guild.  Fires a Channel Delete Gateway event.
deletecloseChannel.responseNote: Returns a guild channel or dm channel object on success.

getChannelMessages.name: Get Channel Messages
getChannelMessages.description: If operating on a guild channel, this endpoint requires the 'READ_MESSAGES' permission to be present on the current user.
getChannelMessages.responseNote: Returns the messages for a channel.

around.description: get messages around this message ID

before.description: get messages before this message ID

after.description: get messages after this message ID

limit.description: max number of messages to return (1-100)

getChannelMessage.name: Get Channel Message
getChannelMessage.description: If operating on a guild channel, this endpoints requires the 'READ_MESSAGE_HISTORY' permission to be present on the current user.
getChannelMessage.responseNote: Returns a specific message in the channel.

createMessage.name: Create Message
createMessage.description: Post a message to a guild text or DM channel. If operating on a guild channel, this endpoint requires the 'SEND_MESSAGES' permission to be present on the current user.  Fires a Message Create Gateway event. See message formatting for more information on how to properly format messages.

nonce.description: a nonce that can be used for optimistic message sending

tts.description: true if this is a TTS message

file.description: the contents of the file being sent

createReaction.name: Create Reaction
createReaction.description: Create a reaction for the message. If nobody else has reacted to the message using this emoji, this endpoint requires the 'ADD_REACTIONS' permission to be present on the current user.
createReaction.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

deleteOwnReaction.name: Delete Own Reaction
deleteOwnReaction.description: Delete a reaction the current user has made for the message.
deleteOwnReaction.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

deleteUserReaction.name: Delete User Reaction
deleteUserReaction.description: Deletes another user's reaction. This endpoint requires the 'MANAGE_MESSAGES' permission to be present on the current user.
deleteUserReaction.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

getReactions.name: Get Reactions
getReactions.description: Get a list of users that reacted with this emoji.
getReactions.responseNote: Returns an array of user objects on success.

deleteAllReactions.name: Delete All Reactions
deleteAllReactions.description: Deletes all reactions on a message. This endpoint requires the 'MANAGE_MESSAGES' permission to be present on the current user.

editMessage.name: Edit Message
editMessage.description: Edit a previously sent message. You can only edit messages that have been sent by the current user.  Fires a Message Update Gateway event.

deleteMessage.name: Delete Message
deleteMessage.description: Delete a message. If operating on a guild channel and trying to delete a message that was not sent by the current user, this endpoint requires the 'MANAGE_MESSAGES' permission.  Fires a Message Delete Gateway event.
deleteMessage.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

bulkDeleteMessages.name: Bulk Delete Messages
bulkDeleteMessages.description: Delete multiple messages in a single request. This endpoint can only be used on guild channels and requires the 'MANAGE_MESSAGES' permission.  Fires multiple Message Delete Gateway events.
bulkDeleteMessages.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

messages.description: an array of message ids to delete

bulkDeleteMessagesDeprecated.name: Bulk Delete Messages (deprecated)
bulkDeleteMessagesDeprecated.description: Same as above, but this endpoint is deprecated.

editChannelPermissions.name: Edit Channel Permissions
editChannelPermissions.description: Edit the channel permission overwrites for a user or role in a channel. Only usable for guild channels. Requires the 'MANAGE_ROLES' permission.  For more information about permissions, see permissions.
editChannelPermissions.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

allow.description: the bitwise value of all allowed permissions

deny.description: the bitwise value of all disallowed permissions

type.description: "member" for a user or "role" for a role

getChannelInvites.name: Get Channel Invites
getChannelInvites.description: Only usable for guild channels. Requires the 'MANAGE_CHANNELS' permission.
getChannelInvites.responseNote: Returns a list of invite objects (with invite metadata) for the channel.

createChannelInvite.name: Create Channel Invite
createChannelInvite.description: Create a new invite object for the channel. Only usable for guild channels. Requires the CREATE_INSTANT_INVITE permission. All JSON paramaters for this route are optional, however the request body is not. If you are not sending any fields, you still have to send an empty JSON object ({}).

max_age.description: duration of invite in seconds before expiry, or 0 for never

max_uses.description: max number of uses or 0 for unlimited

temporary.description: whether this invite only grants temporary membership

unique.description: if true, don't try to reuse a similar invite (useful for creating many unique one time use invites)

deleteChannelPermission.name: Delete Channel Permission
deleteChannelPermission.description: Delete a channel permission overwrite for a user or role in a channel. Only usable for guild channels. Requires the 'MANAGE_ROLES' permission.  For more information about permissions, see permissions
deleteChannelPermission.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

triggerTypingIndicator.name: Trigger Typing Indicator
triggerTypingIndicator.description: Post a typing indicator for the specified channel. Generally bots should not implement this route. However, if a bot is responding to a command and expects the computation to take a few seconds, this endpoint may be called to let the user know that the bot is processing their message.  Fires a Typing Start Gateway event.
triggerTypingIndicator.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

getPinnedMessages.name: Get Pinned Messages
getPinnedMessages.responseNote: Returns all pinned messages in the channel as an array of message objects.

addPinnedChannelMessage.name: Add Pinned Channel Message
addPinnedChannelMessage.description: Pin a message in a channel. Requires the 'MANAGE_MESSAGES' permission.
addPinnedChannelMessage.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

deletePinnedChannelMessage.name: Delete Pinned Channel Message
deletePinnedChannelMessage.description: Delete a pinned message in a channel. Requires the 'MANAGE_MESSAGES' permission.
deletePinnedChannelMessage.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

groupDmAddRecipient.name: Group DM Add Recipient
groupDmAddRecipient.description: Adds a recipient to a Group DM using their access token

access_token.description: access token of a user that has granted your app the gdm.join scope

nick.description: nickname of the user being added

groupDmRemoveRecipient.name: Group DM Remove Recipient
groupDmRemoveRecipient.description: Removes a recipient from a Group DM

getInvite.name: Get Invite
getInvite.responseNote: Returns an invite object for the given code.

deleteInvite.name: Delete Invite
deleteInvite.description: Delete an invite. Requires the MANAGE_CHANNELS permission.
deleteInvite.responseNote: Returns an invite object on success.

acceptInvite.name: Accept Invite
acceptInvite.description: Accept an invite. This is not available to bot accounts, and requires the guilds.join OAuth2 scope to accept on behalf of normal users.
acceptInvite.responseNote: Returns an invite object on success.

getCurrentUser.name: Get Current User
getCurrentUser.description: For OAuth2, this requires the identify scope, which will return the object without an email, and optionally the email scope, which returns the object with an email.
getCurrentUser.responseNote: Returns the user object of the requester's account.

getUser.name: Get User
getUser.responseNote: Returns a user for a given user ID.

modifyCurrentUser.name: Modify Current User
modifyCurrentUser.description: Modify the requestors user account settings.
modifyCurrentUser.responseNote: Returns a user object on success.

username.description: users username, if changed may cause the users discriminator to be randomized.

avatar.description: if passed, modifies the user's avatar

getCurrentUserGuilds.name: Get Current User Guilds
getCurrentUserGuilds.responseNote: Returns a list of user guild objects the current user is a member of.

before.description: get guilds before this guild ID

after.description: get guilds after this guild ID

limit.description: max number of guilds to return (1-100)

leaveGuild.name: Leave Guild
leaveGuild.responseNote: Returns a 204 empty response on success.

getUserDms.name: Get User DMs
getUserDms.responseNote: Returns a list of DM channel objects.

createDm.name: Create DM
createDm.description: Create a new DM channel with a user.

recipient_id.description: the recipient to open a DM channel with

createGroupDm.name: Create Group DM
createGroupDm.description: Create a new group DM channel with multiple users.

access_tokens.description: access tokens of users that have granted your app the gdm.join scope

nicks.description: a dictionary of user ids to their respective nicknames

getUsersConnections.name: Get Users Connections
getUsersConnections.responseNote: Returns a list of connection objects.

listVoiceRegions.name: List Voice Regions
listVoiceRegions.responseNote: Returns an array of voice region objects that can be used when creating servers.

createWebhook.name: Create Webhook
createWebhook.responseNote: Returns a webhook object on success.

avatar.description: base64 128x128 jpeg image for the default webhook avatar

getChannelWebhooks.name: Get Channel Webhooks
getChannelWebhooks.responseNote: Returns a list of channel webhook objects.

getGuildWebhooks.name: Get Guild Webhooks
getGuildWebhooks.responseNote: Returns a list of guild webhook objects.

getWebhook.name: Get Webhook
getWebhook.responseNote: Returns the new webhook object for the given id.

getWebhookWithToken.name: Get Webhook with Token
getWebhookWithToken.description: Same as above, except this call does not require authentication and returns no user in the webhook object.

modifyWebhook.name: Modify Webhook
modifyWebhook.responseNote: Returns the updated webhook object on success.

name.description: the default name of the webhook

avatar.description: base64 128x128 jpeg image for the default webhook avatar

modifyWebhookWithToken.name: Modify Webhook with Token
modifyWebhookWithToken.description: Same as above, except this call does not require authentication and returns no user in the webhook object.

deleteWebhook.name: Delete Webhook
deleteWebhook.description: Delete a webhook permanently. User must be owner.
deleteWebhook.responseNote: Returns a 204 NO CONTENT response on success.

deleteWebhookWithToken.name: Delete Webhook with Token
deleteWebhookWithToken.description: Same as above, except this call does not require authentication.

executeWebhook.name: Execute Webhook
executeWebhook.description: This endpoint supports both JSON and form data bodies. It does require multipart/form-data requests instead of the normal JSON request type when uploading files. Make sure you set your Content-Type to multipart/form-data if you're doing that. Note that in that case, the embeds field cannot be used, but you can pass an url-encoded JSON body as a form value for payload_json.

wait.description: waits for server confirmation of message send before response, and returns the created message body (defaults to false; when false a message that is not saved does not return an error)

executeSlackcompatibleWebhook.name: Execute Slack-Compatible Webhook
executeSlackcompatibleWebhook.description: Refer to Slack's documentation for more information. We do not support Slack's channel, icon_emoji, mrkdwn, or mrkdwn_in properties.

wait.description: waits for server confirmation of message send before response (defaults to true; when false a message that is not saved does not return an error)

executeGithubcompatibleWebhook.name: Execute GitHub-Compatible Webhook
executeGithubcompatibleWebhook.description: Add a new webhook to your GitHub repo (in the repo's settings), and use this endpoint as the "Payload URL." You can choose what events your Discord channel receives by choosing the "Let me select individual events" option and selecting individual events for the new webhook you're configuring.

wait.description: waits for server confirmation of message send before response (defaults to true; when false a message that is not saved does not return an error)

getGateway.name: Get Gateway
getGateway.description: Bots that want to dynamically/automatically spawn shard processes should use this endpoint to determine the number of processes to run. This route should be called once, and the result cached/passed to all processes. This value is not guarenteed to be the same per-call.
getGateway.responseNote: Returns an object with the same information as Get Gateway, plus a shards key, containing the recommended number of shards to connect with (as an integer).

getCurrentApplicationInformation.name: Get Current Application Information
getCurrentApplicationInformation.responseNote: Returns the bot's OAuth2 application info.

icon.description: the icon hash of the app

rpc_origins?.description: an array of rpc origin url strings, if rpc is enabled

bot_public.description: when false only app owner can join the app's bot to guilds

bot_requires_code_grant.description: when true the app's bot will only join upon completion of the full oauth2 code grant flow

owner.description: partial user object containing info on the owner of the application

mfa_level.description: required MFA level for the guild

joined_at.description: date this guild was joined at

large.description: whether this is considered a large guild

member_count.description: total number of members in this guild

voice_states.description: array of voice state objects (without the guild_id key)

presences.description: array of simple presence objects, which share the same fields as Presence Update event sans a roles or guild_id key

unavailableGuild.description: Represents an Offline Guild, or a Guild whose information has not been provided through Guild Create events during the Gateway connect.

nick.description: this users guild nickname (if one is set)

joined_at.description: date the user joined the guild

role_id.description: id that this integration uses for "subscribers"

expire_grace_period.description: the grace period before expiring subscribers

synced_at.description: when this integration was last synced

roles.description: roles this emoji is active for

require_colons.description: whether this emoji must be wrapped in colons

role.description: Roles represent a set of permissions attached to a group of users. Roles have unique names, colors, and can be pinned to the side bar, causing their members to be listed separately. Roles are unique per guild, and can have separate permission profiles for the global context (guild) and channel context.

color.description: integer representation of hexadecimal color code

hoist.description: if this role is pinned in the user listing

managed.description: whether this role is managed by an integration

guildChannel.description: Guild channels represent an isolated set of users and messages within a Guild.

id.description: the id of this channel (will be equal to the guild if it's the "general" channel)

name.description: the name of the channel (2-100 characters)

is_private.description: should always be false for guild channels

last_message_id.description: the id of the last message sent in this channel

bitrate.description: the bitrate (in bits) of the voice channel

user_limit.description: the user limit of the voice channel

dmChannel.description: DM Channels represent a one-to-one conversation between two users, outside of the scope of guilds.

id.description: the id of this private message

is_private.description: should always be true for DM channels

recipient.description: the user object of the DM recipient

last_message_id.description: the id of the last message sent in this DM

message.description: Represents a message sent in a channel within Discord.

channel_id.description: id of the channel the message was sent in

author.description: the author of this message (the author of a message is not guaranteed to be a user*)

edited_timestamp.description: when this message was edited (or null if never)

tts.description: whether this was a TTS message

mentions.description: users specifically mentioned in the message

mention_roles.description: roles specifically mentioned in this message

nonce.description: used for validating a message was sent

webhook_id.description: if the message is generated by a webhook, this is the webhook's id

count.description: times this emoji has been used to react

me.description: whether the current user reacted using this emoji

type.description: type of embed (always "rich" for webhook embeds)

invite.description: Represents a code that when used, adds a user to a guild.

guild.description: the guild this invite is for

channel.description: the channel this invite is for

uses.description: number of times this invite has been used

max_uses.description: max number of times this invite can be used

max_age.description: duration (in seconds) after which the invite expires

temporary.description: whether this invite only grants temporary membership

inviteGuild.description: Represents the parent guild of an invite.

splash.description: hash of the guild splash (or null)

icon.description: hash of the guild icon (or null)

inviteChannel.description: Represents the channel an invite is for.

username.description: the user's username, not unique across the platform

bot.description: whether the user belongs to an OAuth2 application

mfa_enabled.description: whether the user has two factor enabled on their account

verified.description: whether the email on this account has been verified

userGuild.description: A brief version of a guild object

owner.description: true if the user is an owner of the guild

permissions.description: bitwise of the user's enabled/disabled permissions

connection.description: The connection object that the user has attached.

name.description: the username of the connection account

type.description: the service of the connection (twitch, youtube)

integrations.description: an array of partial server integrations

voiceState.description: Used to represent a user's voice connection status.

guild_id.description: the guild id this voice state is for

channel_id.description: the channel id this user is connected to

user_id.description: the user id this voice state is for

session_id.description: the session id for this voice state

deaf.description: whether this user is deafened by the server

mute.description: whether this user is muted by the server

self_deaf.description: whether this user is locally deafened

self_mute.description: whether this user is locally muted

suppress.description: whether this user is muted by the current user

guild_id.description: the guild id this webhook is for

channel_id.description: the channel id this webhook is for

user.description: the user this webhook was created by (not returned when getting a webhook with its token)

name.description: the default name of the webhook

avatar.description: the default avatar of the webhook

token.description: the secure token of the webhook
